description.p: Lada is a tool designed to recover pixelated adult videos (JAV). It helps restore the visual quality of such content, making it more enjoyable to watch:

ul.li: Recover Pixelated Videos: Restore pixelated or mosaic scenes in adult videos.
Watch/Export Videos: Use either the CLI or GUI to watch or export your restored videos.

description.p: The process is pretty resource-intensive and will not run on all hardware. It is required that you install one Lada's Flatpak Add-Ons / Extensions compatible with your GPU.
You can find more information about which GPUs are supported on the project website hosted on Codeberg.

Breaking change: If you're upgrading from a previous version you now have to install one of Lada's Flatpak Add-On matching your GPU (Nvidia or Intel) as the main Flatpak doesn't contain Nvidia-specific libraries anymore.
Features / Improvements:

ul.li: CLI+GUI: Add support for Intel QSV (Quick Sync Video) hardware-encoding
CLI+GUI: Add support for Intel Arc GPUs. Intel Arc-compatible packages of Lada are available for Windows (Standalone) and Flatpak (Install Intel Add-On)
GUI: Add subtitle support. Open .srt file via button or drag-and-drop. If a .srt file exists with same file name as video file then it will be opened automatically
CLI+GUI: Improve processing of corrupt video files. Duplicate previous frame if current frame cannot be decoded (only up to 10 frames, if more frames cannot be read we continue to error out and exit)
GUI: Show playback controls and header bar as an overlay when in Watch view
CLI+GUI: Add new translation: Korean
GUI: Simplified installation from source on Windows by providing pre-compiled GUI dependencies

description.p: This Release is mostly about packaging improvements as this marks the first release for Windows.
Changes:

ul.li: GUI: Drop files onto Export View or use Add button to add to restore queue
GUI: Drop files onto Watch View or use Open button to play them
packaging: Lada is now packaged for Windows

description.p: Revamped the GUI so it can be used with multiple files enabling you to queue a batch of files for restoration. You can choose if you want the start the app in watch mode (watch restored video in realtime) or in export mode (restore one or multiple files in the background to watch later)
Similarly, the CLI now also accepts multiple files by passing a directory of files as input.
Other changes:

ul.li: GUI: Toggle fullscreen mode by double-clicking the video
GUI/CLI: Set file name pattern used to determine file names of output file(s)
GUI: Fix occasional glitch in fullscreen mode where screen became full black (or white on light theme)
GUI: Set custom FFmpeg encoder options. Previously this was only available in CLI
GUI: New setting to choose a default output directory. Use it if you don't want to see the File/Folder dialog when clicking Restore
GUI: Fixed crash when opening files containing audio with samplerate other than 48 kHz. This probably only affected Windows users
CLI: Removed --preserve-relative-scale. --output now is optional. Added --list-devices

Turns out the new "accurate" model introduced in v0.7.1 wasn't as accurate as I hoped. The "fast" model is now the default model, if you need something more accurate try detection model v2 or v3.1-accurate. V2 probably works better in most scenarios.
GUI: Added fullscreen option for Restoration Preview
GUI: Added option to switch color scheme. System ist default (as it has been) but you can also explicitly set dark or light mode if you want or the system detection doesn't work
Packaging:You can now use Nvidia hardware-accelerated video encoders also in Docker and Flatpak builds

Updated mosaic detections models: "fast" and "accurate". "Fast" is pretty much the same model that was shipped in v0.7.0, the new and larger "accurate" model is somewhat slower but catches mosaics which the fast one doesn't detect (new default model).
Detection model can now also be selected in the GUI sidebar
Additional CLI options: --list-mosaic-detection-models, --list-mosaic-restoration-models
Fix GUI becoming unresponsive when models are loaded for the first time (opening a file)
Added build instructions for Windows
New mosaic detection model: Much faster and more accurate
Additional CLI options for video encoding settings: --custom-encoder-options, --list-codecs and --preset
Mosaic restoration: Removes mosaics more consistently, especially on lower-quality videos
Mosaic restoration: Slightly fewer artifacts on certain scenes due to training on a bigger dataset
CLI: create output directory if it doesn't exist instead of crashing
Removed bj-pov finetuned restoration model, no improvement compared to new generic model
Mosaic restoration dataset creation script: more accuracy for the NSFW detection model

description.p: The only user-visible change this time is the inclusion of DeepMosaics pretrained restoration model.
Otherwise, focused on improvements of dataset creation and reducing dependencies to make it easier to build and train new or enhance the existing mosaic restoration model.
Lada is now also available as a docker image on DockerHub (CLI only)

description.p: Huge speed boost on high-performant hardware:
Parts of the restoration pipeline are now being run in parallel with buffering in between each step. This enhances utilization / reduces wait times.
Speed on my RTX 3090 on average doubled compared to v0.3.2. On the Laptop with a throttled RTX 3050 I didn't see a noticeable differance (was already fully utilized on v0.3.2)
You can find detailed speed performance numbers in the README.
